reviews.review: More than CIVIL, more than INFINITY, its an all out WAR with ongoing action with plenty of comedy and surprises! Now the long awaited follow up is another year! Russo Brothers did it just right but can't wait for the Blu Ray for all the extras! Much detail to check out again to watch a second time before Deadpool 2 hopefully. Don't share any spoilers until enough time passes. Too many actors to give kudos to with some special surprise team ups and appearances! What a way to celebrate 10 years of the MCU and glad to see this now before people talk about it! Go see it now!

The best marvel movie I have watch so far, it make you want to know more at the end of the story. First this a superhero movie you will feel ok even is not super hero ending. Very emotional movie, Please watch all previews marvel movie before watch this film.
Amazing.  Great character development for Thanos.  Shocking ending.  I don't know how I'll be able to sleep tonight.
Thanos is the best thing to happen to the MCU. Can't wait till the next one, where he shows us what he really can do.

Lacks CONSISTENT narrative plot

Lacks compelling villian
- Thanos' purpose for wanting the death of half the universe is watered down from the comic STORY LINE, most likely to suit less mature audiences. They replace his compelling comic STORY LINE with an non-COMPELLING history. 

Lacks Compelling heroes
- All the heroes do for this entire move is shoot things and throw things. Only Tony Stark is ever GIVEN a valid reason for wanting to survive Thanos' proposed ANNIHILATION. The other JUST seem to be there. This is not to mention that there seems to be a lack of impact from Civil war, and no hero seems to hold any residual grudges. They also never formally resolve their differences in regard to the civil war.

Poor Humor
- In the THEATER I attended, most of the intended humor went unnoticed, with only a few being big hitters.

No Narrative Plot
- The narrative is incomplete, with the only conceivable climax taking place at the end of the film, meaning that there is no resolution. The secondary narrative of Bruce banner takes place over a 15 minute period, and also lacks any sort of resolution.

The CGI is good (except Thor's lightning is not so stellar) and the action sequences are stellar, but I didn't watch the movie for these.
Excellent movie there were some problems with the end but i expect something satisfying enough in the next one

Spectacular, Immersive & Incomplete: Movie starts off on a darker note than most Avenger movies but also immediately gets funnier. There are so many MCU heroes in this movie, it can be mind boggling but the movie does a good job of integrating them into the storyline. Thanos is just the perfect villian, but the ending of the movie leaves a lot of things unexplained...

This movie requires a lot from the audience. Unless you have already watched all the individual movies there is a good chance you are going to be lost. I am a fairly big super hero fan and even I was a tad bit lost because I never watched Defenders of the Galaxy.

I feel like I need to watch this movie at least six or seven times before the bredth of it can fully be locked into my brain. That said, this was the most magical culmination of ten years of Marvel Studios. It didn't feel as long as it was. I took my eight-year-old daughter, and both of us sat there shattered at the end, clutching each other. I feel as though I need to grieve, and yet I know there is more to come. I am very excited for the next chapter, and my heart is broken for this one. Thank you Kevin Feige for the beautiful ten years of story telling, as you have put together a gorgious jewel for the top of the crown in Infinity War.

A perfect wait, every character had a role to play in the movie. The war to save the universe was just jaw dropping from the start of the movie till the end. The movie gives you mix emotions at the end and with more expectation for the part 2.
